perturbation.original_text: 5.3 THE NETTAXI SERVICES FURNISHED AS A RESULT OF OR UNDER THIS AGREEMENT ARE PROVIDED ON AN "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT ANY WARRANTIES OR REPRESENTATIONS EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY; INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, WARRANTIES OF QUALITY, PERFORMANCE, NONINFRINGEMENT, MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. NOR ARE THERE ANY WARRANTIES CREATED BY A COURSE OF DEALING, COURSE OF PERFORMANCE OR TRADE USAGE. NETTAXI DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE SERVICES, WILL MEET SPINRECORDS.COM'S OR ANY END USERS NEEDS OR BE FREE FROM ERRORS, OR THAT THE OPERATION OF ITS WEB PAGES WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED. THE FOREGOING EXCLUSIONS AND DISCLAIMERS ARE AN ESSENTIAL PART OF THIS AGREEMENT.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3 THE NETTAXI SERVICES FURNISHED AS A RESULT OF OR UNDER THIS AGREEMENT ARE PROVIDED ON AN "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT ANY WARRANTIES OR REPRESENTATIONS.
perturbation.explanation: The original text disclaims all warranties, including implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. While disclaiming warranties is common, completely removing the implied warranty of merchantability may violate consumer protection laws, particularly the implied warranty of merchantability. This is especially problematic in California (where NETTAXI is located) under the Song-Beverly Consumer Warranty Act, which implies certain warranties even when others are disclaimed. This change introduces a potential legal risk because it leaves NETTAXI potentially exposed to claims that its services do not meet basic standards of functionality and quality, which are difficult to completely waive. By making the disclaimer incredibly basic, NETTAXI opens itself to a higher degree of liability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Song-Beverly Consumer Warranty Act; Implied Warranty of Merchantability under California Commercial Code

perturbation.original_text: 5.5 SpinRecords.com Rate. In full consideration for the rights granted --------------------- by NETTAXI, SpinRecords.com agrees to pay NETTAXI fifty (50%) percent of ad revenue at an average rate no lower then $6.50 per one thousand impressions (CPM) payable to NETTAXI which results when the SpinRecords.com Advertising Revenue is multiplied by SpinRecords.com's AR Share. SpinRecords.com shall be responsible for payment of all taxes based on the Advertising Revenue except taxes based on NETTAXI's income.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.5 SpinRecords.com Rate. In full consideration for the rights granted --------------------- by NETTAXI, SpinRecords.com agrees to pay NETTAXI fifty (50%) percent of ad revenue which results when the SpinRecords.com Advertising Revenue is multiplied by SpinRecords.com's AR Share. SpinRecords.com shall be responsible for payment of all taxes based on the Advertising Revenue except taxes based on NETTAXI's income.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of 'at an average rate no lower then $6.50 per one thousand impressions (CPM) payable to NETTAXI' significantly alters the compensation terms. This can be problematic because it eliminates the guaranteed minimum rate, potentially leading to disputes over fair compensation and implying an unfair business practice. California law, under the umbrella of good faith and fair dealing, expects clarity and reasonable financial terms in contracts. The omission creates a loophole allowing for a far lower compensation rate, potentially undermining the financial benefit NETTAXI expects, violating the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing under California law; potential violation of fair business practice laws.

perturbation.original_text: 9.10 Controlling Law and Jurisdiction. This Agreement and any action ----------------------------------- related thereto shall be governed, controlled, interpreted and defined by and under the laws of the State of California and the United States, without regard to the conflicts of laws provisions thereof. Unless waived by NETTAXI (which it may do in its sole discretion) the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of any action with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement shall be the Superior Court of California for the County of Santa Clara or the United States District Court for the Northern District of California and each of the parties hereto submits itself to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of such courts for the purpose of any such action. The parties specifically disclaim the UN Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.10 Controlling Law and Jurisdiction. This Agreement and any action ----------------------------------- related thereto shall be governed, controlled, interpreted and defined by and under the laws of the State of California, without regard to the conflicts of laws provisions thereof. The parties specifically disclaim the UN Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the phrase 'and the United States' creates ambiguity regarding the applicability of federal laws. While California law is chosen, certain aspects of the agreement (e.g., intellectual property rights) are heavily influenced by federal statutes. Omission could create legal risk and disputes regarding which body of law governs specific aspects of the agreement. While IP rights will be governed by federal law regardless, failing to specify creates a legal ambiguity and increases the potential for disputes regarding interpretation and enforcement, as well as increases the amount of legal fees needed to argue the case in court. There is also the omission of the California court of jurisdiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Copyright Act, Federal Trademark Act; applicable provisions of federal intellectual property law; The ambiguity and omission here could have impact, making this a legal contradiction.
